intro: Schizoglossum divaricatum, commonly known as the variable thimbleweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in prairies and along stream banks. Schizoglossum divaricatum is a perennial herb that can reach heights of up to 1 meter.
